page.title: 15Forestry in Moy
page.content: 301ha Plantation near Tullochclury and Moy Burn consists mainly of coniferous trees with a few Birch, Sycamore, Ash, Alder and Lime. The conifers are Scots Pine 169ha, Sitka Spruce 66ha, Norway Spruce(Christmas Tree) 12ha, Lodgepole Pine 6ha, Japanese Larch(Deciduous Conifer) 26ha, Douglas Fir 4ha and unplanted ground 18ha. Planting from 1947 to 1952 with restocking of failed area in 1972. Ages of trees between 33 - 38 years old. Older outcrops estimated at 85 years planted around 1900. No nursery areas. Plants brought in from nurseries at Dornoch _ Black Isle, or Newton near Elgin. No recent fires. No recent fellings except for roadlines and 6ha first thinnings. No large scale disease. Insect pests minimal.
